com.fdmgroup.userregistrationsystem

Class RegistrationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fdmgroup.userregistrationsystem.RegistrationController

  • public class RegistrationController
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a controller that will register new users. A new user will consist of a: username, password, and role.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Brian.Albers

      This is the constructor for the RegistrationController object.

      void registerNewUser(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String role)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegistrationController

        public RegistrationController(UserFactory uf,
                              WriteCommand wc,
                              ReadCommand rdc)
                       throws NullException
        This is the constructor for the RegistrationController object. It sets the UserFactory, WriteCommand, and ReadCommand objects to the object parameters supplied by the client
        Parameters:
        uf - Reference to an UserFactory object. Must not be null
        wc - Reference to a WriteCommand object. Must not be null
        rdc - Reference to a ReadCommand object. Must not be null
        Throws:
        NullException - Custom Exception called it client passes null as a parameter
        See Also:
        UserFactory, WriteCommand, ReadCommand, NullException

    • Method Detail

      • registerNewUser

        public void registerNewUser(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            java.lang.String role)
                     throws NullException,
                            EmptyStringException
        This method will take parameters supplied by the client and create a new User object via the UserFactory class
        Parameters:
        username - String containing a username supplied by a client. Must not be null.
        password - String containing a password supplied by a client. Must not be null.
        role - String containing a role supplied by a client. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        NullException - Exception called when client passes null as a parameter
        EmptyStringException - Exception called when client passes an empty String
        See Also:
        User, UserFactory, NullException, EmptyStringException
